item.title: Bitcoin Dev Peter Todd: Forced Soft Forks Send a "Dangerous Message"
item.description:
Bitcoin Dev Peter Todd: Forced Soft Forks Send a "Dangerous Message"

In a recent blog post, Peter Todd, one of the more active bitcoin developers, raised the prospects of an amicable end to the so-called "civil war". Setting out a condition, Todd states: "If major industry players were willing to commit to layer 2 solutions, I'd be willing to support something like a forced soft fork, and I'd be willing to support a coin voting hard fork even if they didn't."

item.title: Bitcoin Will Help Mexicans to Overcome Trump's Border Wall
item.description:
Bitcoin Will Help Mexicans to Overcome Trump's Border Wall

Bitcoin enthusiasts suggest the use of Bitcoin in settling remittances between the U.S and Mexico after Trump's proposal to build a wall between the two countries will have been realised.

item.title: Ether Prices Plunge 50% as Bitcoin Stays in Holding Pattern - CoinDesk
item.description:
Ether Prices Plunge 50% as Bitcoin Stays in Holding Pattern - CoinDesk

Markets Weekly is a weekly column analyzing price movements in the global digital currency markets, and the technology's use case as an asset class Bitcoin prices fluctuated largely within a tight range between $415 and $425 during the seven days ending 15th April, while the value of ether, the native token on the Ethereum blockchain, declined sharply after weeks of advances.

item.title: Did Bitcoin Lead To Birth Of Ransomware?
item.description:
Did Bitcoin Lead To Birth Of Ransomware?

Ransomware, rogue software which encrypt data on your hard disk and demand payment in bitcoins to restore it, have been on the rise recently. Hospitals, police stations and universities have been the recent targets of ransomware. What exactly are the causes of the increase in ransomware and did Bitcoin lead to its birth?

item.title: Bitcoin: Privacy, Identity, Surveillance and Money - Barcelona Fablab Meetup March 2016
item.description:
Bitcoin: Privacy, Identity, Surveillance and Money - Barcelona Fablab Meetup March 2016

A talk about privacy, identity, surveillance, hierarchies and the future of network-centric private and secure money.

item.title: Who really owns the 'Internet of Money'?
item.description:
Who really owns the 'Internet of Money'?

What exactly is the Blockchain? Now watching What exactly is the Blockchain? Regulators moving to require registration of drones Regulators moving to require registration of drones Some people in the bitcoin world-the believers still waving the flag for the leading digital currency, which is currently trading at $427-will tell you that the phrase "The Internet of Money" is widely understood as a reference to bitcoin and its underlying technology, the blockchain.

item.title: Bitcoin Core 0.12.1 Released, Major Step Forward for Scalability
item.description:
Bitcoin Core 0.12.1 Released, Major Step Forward for Scalability

Bitcoin Core 0.12.1 was released early this morning and the update includes several changes that have huge implications for Bitcoin scalability . The release deploys the first soft fork on the Bitcoin network to use the methodology outlined in BIP 9 (Version Bits), which allows multiple soft forks to take place at the same time.

item.title: Yope are nexuslab blockchain finalists - Digital Chains
item.description:
Yope are nexuslab blockchain finalists - Digital Chains

You know that feeling when you've been working really hard on something and it all suddenly falls into place? At Yope, we all got that feeling yesterday when we found out we were one of the ten finalists chosen out of 260 blockchain startups from all over Europe to join the first cohort of the nexuslab virtual bootcamp.

item.title: Is centralization in the Lightning network inevitable? Why (not)?
item.description:
Is centralization in the Lightning network inevitable? Why (not)?

Bitcoin Stack Exchange is a question and answer site for Bitcoin crypto-currency enthusiasts. It's 100% free, no registration required. Sign up Here's how it works: Anybody can ask a question Anybody can answer The best answers are voted up and rise to the top Especially keeping in mind the possibility of single-funded channels (see Tadge's Google Doc Slides), buying from an exchange and concurrently opening a payment channel on the Lightning network would seem a particularly simple entry to the LN.
